tit.j: 京都国際マンガミュージアム

sen.j: 京都国際マンガミュージアム（きょうとこくさいマンガミュージアム、Kyoto International Manga Museum）とは京都市中京区の旧・京都市立龍池小学校跡地にある漫画の博物館である。
sen.e: The Kyoto International Manga Museum is a manga museum established on the site of the former Tatsuike Elementary School in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City.
The Kyoto International Manga Museum is a manga museum established on the site of the former Tatsuike Elementary School in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City.
The Kyoto International Manga Museum is a manga museum established on the site of the former Tatsuike Elementary School in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 国内外の漫画に関する貴重な資料を集める日本初の総合的な漫画ミュージアムとして2006年11月25日に開館した。
sen.e: The museum was opened on November 25, 2006 as the first comprehensive manga museum in Japan and houses valuable domestic and overseas materials regarding cartoons and comics.
The museum was opened on November 25, 2006 as the first comprehensive manga museum in Japan and houses valuable domestic and overseas materials regarding cartoons and comics.
The museum was opened on November 25, 2006 as the first comprehensive manga museum in Japan and houses valuable domestic and overseas materials regarding cartoons and comics.

sen.j: 明治時代の雑誌や戦後の貸本などの貴重な歴史資料、現代の人気作品、世界各国の名作など約20万点を所蔵している。
sen.e: It contains a collection of around 200,000 items, including important historical materials such as Meiji-period magazines and rental books of the postwar period, modern popular comics, and masterpieces around the world.

It contains a collection of around 200,000 items, including important historical materials such as Meiji-period magazines and rental books of the postwar period, modern popular comics, and masterpieces around the world.

It contains a collection of around 200,000 items, including important historical materials such as Meiji-period magazines and rental books of the postwar period, modern popular comics, and masterpieces around the world.

sen.j: マンガ学部を持つ京都精華大学と土地・建物を提供した京都市によって共同事業として整備が進められた。
sen.e: The museum was developed as a joint project of Kyoto Seika University that has the Faculty of Manga and Kyoto City who provided the land and building.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The museum was developed as a joint project of Kyoto Seika University that has a Faculty of Manga, and Kyoto City, that provided the land and building.
The museum was developed as a joint project of Kyoto Seika University that has a Faculty of Manga, and Kyoto City, that provided the land and building.

sen.j: 現在は市と大学で組織される運営委員会の下、大学が管理・運営している。
sen.e: Now the university manages and operates the museum under the supervision of the steering committee organized by the city and the university,
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Now the university manages and operates the museum under the supervision of the steering committee organized by the city and the university,
Now the university manages and operates the museum under the supervision of the steering committee organized by the city and the university.

sen.j: 館長には『バカの壁』などの著書で知られる解剖学者・養老孟司が非常勤で就任している。
sen.e: Takeshi YORO, an anatomist who is know as the author of "The Wall of Fools" and others, serves as part-time Executive Director.
Takeshi YORO, an anatomist who is known as the author of "The Wall of Fools" and others, serves as a part-time Executive Director.
Takeshi YORO, an anatomist who is known as the author of "The Wall of Fools" and others, serves as a part-time Executive Director.

sen.j: また近世思想史や美術史などを専攻する研究員4人が所属し、まんが文化の研究にあたっている。
sen.e: In the museum, four researchers specializing in modern history of thought, art history, etc. have conducted research on manga culture.
In the museum, four researchers specializing in modern history of thought, art history, etc. have conducted research on manga culture.
In the museum, four researchers specializing in modern history of thought, art history, and so on, have conducted research on manga culture.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 施設は廃校になった旧・龍池小学校の校舎を改築（一部増築）して利用している。
sen.e: The campus of the former Tatsuike Elementary School was renovated (partially enlarged) and converted to the museum building.
The campus of the former Tatsuike Elementary School was renovated (partially enlarged) and converted to the museum building.
The campus of the former Tatsuike Elementary School, which was closed, was renovated (partially enlarged) and converted to the museum building.

sen.j: この建物の改修及び設計は、類設計室が行った。
sen.e: Rui Sekkeishitsu Co., Ltd. was in charge of renovating and designing the building.
Rui Sekkeishitsu Co., Ltd. was in charge of renovating and designing the building.
Rui Sekkeishitsu Co., Ltd. was in charge of renovating and designing the building.

sen.j: 旧・龍池小学校の本館・講堂・北校舎・正門及び塀だった建物は2008年7月23日に国の登録有形文化財に登録された。
sen.e: Buildings that used to be the main building, assembly hall, north building, main gate and walls of the former Tatsuike Elementary School were designated as registered tangible cultural properties of Japan in July 23, 2008.

Buildings that used to be the main building, assembly hall, north building, main gate and walls of the former Tatsuike Elementary School were designated as registered tangible cultural properties of Japan on July 23, 2008.

Buildings that used to be the main building, assembly hall, north building, main gate and walls of the former Tatsuike Elementary School were designated as registered tangible cultural properties of Japan on July 23, 2008.

sen.j: 一般公開のギャラリーゾーン、研究ゾーン、資料収蔵ゾーン、地域利便施設によって構成されており常設展示、企画展示、龍池歴史記念室の他、ミュージアムショップ、喫茶が併設されている。
sen.e: The museum consists of Gallery Zone which is open to the public, the Research Zone, the Archive Zone, and a community space, and also has permanent and special exhibition rooms, the Tatsuike History and Memorial Room, a museum shop, and a tea room.

The museum consists of Gallery Zone which is open to the public, the Research Zone, the Archive Zone, and a community space, and also has permanent and special exhibition rooms, the Tatsuike History and Memorial Room, a museum shop, and a tea room.

The museum consists of Gallery Zone which is open to the public, the Research Zone, the Archive Zone, and a community space, and also has permanent and special exhibition rooms, the Tatsuike History and Memorial Room, a museum shop, and a tea room.

sen.j: ミュージアムの顔としては、総延長140メートルの書架に4万冊が並ぶ「マンガ本の壁」がある。
sen.e: The main focus of the museum is the book shelves called "Wall of Manga," which is 140 meters long in total and contain as many as 40,000 publications.
The main focus of the museum is the book shelves called "Wall of Manga," which is 140 meters long in total and contain as many as 40,000 publications.
The main focus of the museum is the book shelves called 'Wall of Manga,' which is 140 meters long in total and contain as many as 40,000 publications.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: また屋外の芝生にマンガを持ち出して読むことが可能。
sen.e: Visitors can also take the manga books outside to read on the lawn.
Visitors can also take the manga books outside to read on the lawn.
Visitors can also take the manga books outside to read on the lawn.

sen.j: 一度チケット購入すれば、その日の内なら何度でも再入場も可能である。
sen.e: Tickets holders can re-enter multiple times throughout the day.
Tickets holders can re-enter multiple times throughout the day.
Tickets holders can re-enter multiple times throughout the day.

sen.j: 日本国内の資料以外に世界各国の日本マンガの現地版や日本以外の国のマンガも収蔵されており、うち約1,340冊が開架図書として公開されている。
sen.e: The museum houses domestic materials as well as local editions of Japanese manga around the world and comic books from foreign countries, of which around 1,340 items are arranged for open access.
The museum houses domestic materials as well as local editions of Japanese manga around the world and comic books from foreign countries, of which around 1,340 items are arranged for open access.
The museum houses domestic materials as well as local editions of Japanese manga around the world and comic books from foreign countries, of which around 1,340 items are arranged for open access.

sen.j: それらの収集にはオーストラリアのモナシュ大学日本研究センターやドイツのライプチヒ大学が協力している。
sen.e: They have been colleted with the help of Japanese studies Centre, Monash University in Australia and The University of Leipzig in Germany.
They have been collected with the help of Japanese studies Centre, Monash University in Australia and The University of Leipzig in Germany.
They have been collected with the help of Japanese studies Centre, Monash University in Australia and The University of Leipzig in Germany.

sen.j: マンガミュージアムの開設のコンセプト：公民協働（PPPPublic-Private Partnership）
sen.e: Concept for the establishment of the manga museum: PPPPublic-Private Partnership
Concept for the establishment of the manga museum: PPP (Public-Private Partnership)
Concept for the establishment of the manga museum: PPP (Public-Private Partnership)

sen.j: マンガ・アニメーションを体系的に研究し生涯学習、観光誘致、人材育成や新産業創出等への活用を図るため資料の収集・展示・保存を市と大学の共同により行い、その成果を地域社会の文化活動に対しても還元・貢献できる形態は他地域の先進事例となることが注目されている。
sen.e: The museum has attracted attention as an example to be followed in other regions in that the city and university jointly collect, exhibit and preserve materials so that the systematic study of manga and animations can help promote the lifelong learning, tourism activation, development of human resources and creation of new industries, the fruits of which can be shared with and contribute to the cultural activities of local communities.

The museum has attracted attention as an example to be followed in other regions in that the city and the university jointly collects, exhibits and preserves materials so that the systematic study of manga and animation can help promote the lifelong learning, tourism activation, development of human resources and creation of new industries, the fruits of which can be shared and can contribute to the cultural activities of local communities.

The museum has attracted attention as an example to be followed in other regions in that the city and the university jointly collects, exhibits and preserves materials so that the systematic study of manga and animation can help promote the lifelong learning, tourism activation, development of human resources and creation of new industries, the fruits of which can be shared and can contribute to the cultural activities of local communities.

sen.j: 1995年4月 龍池小学校が、周辺の4小学校と統合される。
sen.e: April 1995: The Tatsuike Elementary School was merged with surrounding four elementary schools.
April 1995: The Tatsuike Elementary School merged with the surrounding four elementary schools.
April 1995: The Tatsuike Elementary School merged with the surrounding four elementary schools.

sen.j: 4月 京都精華大学から京都市に、マンガミュージアム構想について提案。
sen.e: April: Kyoto Seika University proposed a plan of establishing a manga museum to the Kyoto City.
April: Kyoto Seika University proposed a plan to establish a manga museum to the Kyoto City.
April: Kyoto Seika University proposed a plan to establish a manga museum to the Kyoto City.

sen.j: 12月 本構想について基本合意。
sen.e: December: Kyoto Seika University and Kyoto City reached a basic agreement on this plan.
December: Kyoto Seika University and Kyoto City reached a basic agreement on this plan.
December: They reached a basic agreement on this plan.

sen.j: 2006年11月 京都国際マンガミュージアムが開館。
sen.e: November 2006: Kyoto International Manga Museum was opened.
November 2006: Kyoto International Manga Museum was opened.
November 2006: Kyoto International Manga Museum was opened.

sen.j: 2007年11月 開館から1周年。
sen.e: November 2007: The museum marked its first anniversary.
November 2007: The museum marked its first anniversary.
November 2007: The museum marked its first anniversary.

sen.j: 来館者は当初予想より5割増の22万7千人に達し、うち3万人は外国人。
sen.e: The number of visitors reached 227,000, which was 50% more than originally expected, and 30,000 of them were from foreign countries.
The number of visitors reached 227,000, which was 50% more than originally expected, and 30,000 of them were from foreign countries.
The number of visitors reached 227,000, which was 50% more than originally expected, and 30,000 of them were from foreign countries.

sen.j: 2008年7月 国の登録有形文化財に登録。
sen.e: July 2008: The museum was designated as registered tangible cultural properties of Japan.
July 2008: The museum was designated as a registered tangible cultural property of Japan.
July 2008: The museum was designated as a registered tangible cultural property of Japan.

sen.j: 横浜市でイギリス人・C.ワーグマンが発行していた『ジャパン・パンチ』（1862年～1887年）
sen.e: "The Japan Punch" (1862-1887) issued by Briton C. Wirgman in Yokohama City
"The Japan Punch" (1862-1887) issued by Briton C. Wirgman in Yokohama City
"The Japan Punch" (1862 - 1887) issued by Briton C. Wirgman in Yokohama City
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。

sen.j: 日本人が刊行した最初の漫画雑誌とされる『絵新聞日本地』（1874年発行）
sen.e: "Eshinbun Nipponchi" (Picture Newspaper + a play on "Japan" and "Punch") (issued in 1874) which is thought to be the first comic book published by Japanese people
"Eshinbun Nipponchi" (Picture Newspaper + a play on "Japan" and "Punch") (issued in 1874) which is thought to be the first comic book published by Japanese people
"Eshinbun Nipponchi" (Picture Newspaper which plays on "Japan" and "Punch") (issued in 1874) which is thought to be the first comic book published by Japanese people

sen.j: 日本最初の子供向け漫画雑誌とされる『少年パック』（1907年創刊）
sen.e: "Shonen Pakku" (Boy Puck) (first published in 1907) which is considered the first comic magazine for children in Japan.
"Shonen Pakku" (Boy Puck) (first published in 1907) which is considered the first comic magazine for children in Japan.
"Shonen Pakku" (Boy Puck) (first published in 1907) which is considered the first comic magazine for children in Japan.

sen.e: And so on.
And so on.

sen.j: 大人 500円 / 中高生 300円 / 小学生 100円
sen.e: Adults 500 yen/High and junior high school students 300 yen/Elementary school students 100 yen
Adults 500 yen/High and junior high school students 300 yen/Elementary school students 100 yen

sen.j: 特別展については別途必要
sen.e: Additional fees are required for special exhibitions.
Additional fees are required for special exhibitions.
Additional fees are required for special exhibitions.

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄烏丸線・京都市営地下鉄東西線「烏丸御池駅」 2番出口すぐ。
sen.e: Next to the Exit No.2 of "Karasuma Oike Station" of the Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line and Tozai Line.
sen.cmt: 文頭が「京都市営地下鉄京都市営地下鉄」となっていますが、「京都市営地下鉄」として訳しています。
sen.e: Next to Exit No.2 at "Karasuma Oike Station" on the Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line and Tozai Line.
Next to Exit No.2 at 'Karasuma Oike Station' on the Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line and Tozai Line.
sen.cmt: リンク文字列「京都市営地下鉄」を原文から削除し、クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: なお烏丸御池駅は烏丸通（南北方向）と御池通（東西方向）の交差点の下にあるが、2番出口は御池通側に出てくる（北西角の西側）。
sen.e: Karasuma Oike Station is located beneath the intersection of Karasuma-dori Street (north-south street) and Oike-dori Street (east-west street), and Exit No.2 opens to Oike-dori Street (west of the northwest corner of the intersection).

Karasuma Oike Station is located beneath the intersection of Karasuma-dori Street (north-south street) and Oike-dori Street (east-west street), and Exit No.2 opens to Oike-dori Street (west of the northwest corner of the intersection).

Karasuma Oike Station is located beneath the intersection of Karasuma-dori Street (north-south street) and Oike-dori Street (east-west street), and Exit No.2 opens to Oike-dori Street (west of the northwest corner of the intersection).

sen.j: ミュージアムは烏丸通側（北西角の北側）にあるので、そのまま歩くとたどり着かない。
sen.e: The museum faces Karasuma-dori Street (north of the northwest corner of the intersection), so if you keep going straight from the exit, you cannot find the museum.
The museum faces Karasuma-dori Street (north of the northwest corner of the intersection), so if you continue going straight from the exit, you cannot find the museum.
The museum faces Karasuma-dori Street (north of the northwest corner of the intersection), so if you continue going straight from the exit, you cannot find the museum.

sen.j: 地上に上がったら後ろを振り向いた所にある交差点を左折して烏丸通を北へ歩くこと。
sen.e: After going up to the ground and turning around, turn left at the intersection in front of you and walk north along the Karasuma-dori Street.
After reaching ground level and turning around, turn left at the intersection in front of you and walk north along the Karasuma-dori Street.
After reaching ground level and turning around, turn left at the intersection in front of you and walk north along the Karasuma-dori Street.

sen.j: 京都市バス（15、51、65系統）・京都バス（61、62、63系統）「烏丸御池」バス停留所下車すぐ
sen.e: Next to the "Karasuma Oike" bus stop of Kyoto City Bus (Line Nos. 15, 51, 65) and Kyoto Bus (Line Nos. 61, 62, 63).
Next to the "Karasuma Oike" bus stop of Kyoto City Bus (Line Nos. 15, 51, 65) and Kyoto Bus (Line Nos. 61, 62, 63).
Next to the 'Karasuma Oike' bus stop of Kyoto City Bus (Line Nos. 15, 51, 65) and Kyoto Bus (Line Nos. 61, 62, 63).
